item.title: NMI #001 Nintendo, YouTube, and NetFlix
item.itunes:author: 3rdPass.media
item.itunes:summary:
New Media Interchange is a podcast spotlighting various developments in New Media & focusing on the media world beyond mainstream television and radio, including podcasting, YouTube, live streaming, gaming and more. Hosted by Douglas E. Welch , pioneer podcaster, blogger and new media consultant.
On this Preview episode we talk about the relationship between Nintendo and those who stream Nintendo games on YouTube; and how Netflix plans to spend $5B on original programming.
Nintendo Updates Their Bad YouTube Policies By Making Them Worse http://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2015/02/06/nintendo-updates-their-bad-youtube-policies-by-making-them-worse/
Netflix will spend $5 billion on programming in 2016, more than everyone but ESPN http://www.businessinsider.com/netflix-will-spend-5-billion-on-programming-in-2016-2015-2#ixzz3XtpN3GG4
Want To Know The Best Days And Times To Post YouTube Videos? Here’s A Yearly Calendar. http://www.tubefilter.com/2015/01/12/best-days-times-to-post-youtube-videos-yearly-calendar/
http://twitter.com/NMIPodcast http://3rdPass.media

item.title: Mindful(l) Media: DC Fontana, Star Trek and Women
item.itunes:author: 3rdPass.media
item.itunes:summary:
Listen as Dr Rosanne Welch helps teach the audience to be more Mindfull about the Media we both create and consume as it relates to the portrayal of Gender, Diversity, and Equality.
In this Preview Episode, Dr Welch details what she hopes to accomplish with the podcast, followed by an essay on the Inspirational Dorothy Catherine "D.C." Fontana, best known for her script and story work for the Original Star Trek television series.
item.itunes:subtitle: Listen as Dr Rosanne Welch helps teach the audien…
item.description:
Listen as Dr Rosanne Welch helps teach the audience to be more Mindfull about the Media we both create and consume as it relates to the portrayal of Gender, Diversity, and Equality.
In this Preview Episode, Dr Welch details what she hopes to accomplish with the podcast, followed by an essay on the Inspirational Dorothy Catherine "D.C." Fontana, best known for her script and story work for the Original Star Trek television series.
